ENVIRONMENTAL LAW

2. C Shastri, Environmental Law, 4th Edition, 2012.

UNIT I - Idea of Environment

Essay Type

  1. Define Environment. What are the guiding principles of Environmental Ethics in Ancient lndia ?
  1. What are the factors responsible for environmental pollution and state the remedies .
    (or)
    Uncontrolled growth of population and economic development are the two main causes of environmental pollution. Substantiate.
    3x
  1. Define the term 'pollution' and explain the different kinds of pollution .
  1. What is meant by ' Global Warming ' ? How does it affect environment ?
    (or)
    What is
    green house effect ? Discuss the consequences of global warming. 2x
  1. What is Ecosystem ? What are ecosystem services ?
  1. State the laws relating to control the various forms of environmental pollution in lndia.
  1. Critically analyse the theory of inter-generational equity with the help of decided cases.

Short Note

  1. Write a note on environmental ethics in ancient times.
  1. Write a note on global warming.
  1. Ecosystem service.
  1. Green House Effect.

Problem Questions

UNIT II - Environmental Policy and Law

Essay Type

  1. Discuss the rule of ' Absolute Liability ' with the help of decided cases. 5x
  1. Discuss the environmental dimensions of Article 21 of the lndian Constitution with the help of decided cases.

    (or)

    Critically analyse the fundamental right to live in a healthy environment with the help of decided cases. 4x

  1. Examine the Constitutional obligation of the State to protect the natural environment.
    (or)
    What are the
    different provisions of the Constitution concerning the Protection of Environment ? 3x
  1. Discuss 'Polluter Pays' principle with the help of decided cases. 3x
  1. Explain the significant role of Supreme Court of India in protection of environment in lndia.
  1. Explain the Genesis of ' Precautionary principle ' in protection of Environment.
  1. Discuss the History of Environment Protection in lndia.
  1. Discuss the environmental protection during the post lndependence era . 2x
  1. Explain in brief, the different doctrines evolved for the protection of environment.
  1. What are the remedies available under tort law to an individual against pollution of environment?
  1. State the Public Interest Litigation in respect of Noise pollution with the help of leading cases.
  1. Write the pre-independence history of forest policy and legislation in India.

Short Note

  1. Public trust doctrine. 2x
  1. Polluter pays principle. 2x
  1. Absolute liability.
  1. Right to clean and healthy environment.
  1. Genisis of precautionary principle.
  1. Public lnterest Litigation and Noise Pollutionâ€™

Problem Questions

  1. A municipal corporation issued a licence for construction of buildings on some municipal sites. A petitioner suspecting irregularity in issual of licence, applied for the copy of building plan and proceeding to grant licence, under the constitutional provisions. Advise.
  1. Ramdurga city corporation has not cleaned the city and bad sanitary condition prevailed in the city. The reason given by the Corporation is poor finance and poor city of staff. The city civilians affected by unhygienic condition in the city. Advise the civilians to protect their rights.
  • The Government of Karnataka proposed a scheme to deport the pavement and slum dwellers from major cities in the State with the idea to improve environment. what is the constitutional remedy available to the slum dwellers ?

    Olga Tellis v. Bombay Municipal Corporation - Shastri pg. 57

    • The emissions generated by the hazardous industries in and around the famous monument Taj Mahal are causing damage to the Taj and people living around raj. one Mr. 'X'wants to file public interest litigation. Advise.

      M.C Mehta vs Union of India (Taj Trapezium case) - pg. 63

  1. Span Motels built a resort on the bank of the Beas'river. During Monsoons, the river engulfed part of the lanh and threatened the resort. ln an effoft to protect its property, both before and after the floods, Span Motels carried out substantialwork to deflect the flow of the river. 'X' wants to file a public interest litigation against Span Motels. Advise.
  1. The State of "Chanakyapura did not protecting the endangered animars and taking plea of did not have enough money to rescue the endangered animals. Whether the State can take the plea and what is the duty of the State under the Constitution ?
  1. A rubber industry was situated in the industrial estate and was given licence under Panchayaths and department of industry. The industry using carbon black in huge quantities, polluted the atmosphere and failed to apply the preventive measures resulted in discomforts, injury and nuisance to the resident of the locality. Suggest remedies available under tort law.

UNIT III - International Law & Environmental Protection

Essay Type

  1. Why Rio Summit is considered an important mirestone in establishing linkages between environment and development in defining the concept of sustainable development?
    (or)
    Discuss the significance of Rio-Summit and its
    principles . 4x
  1. What is sustainable development ? Explain the role of courts in this regard.
    (or)
    Explain the sustainable development principle.
    3x - pg. 254, Leelakrishnan
  1. What is public nuisance ? Explain the provisions of criminal law relating to the abatement of public nuisance. 2x
  1. State the impact of ' Stockholm declaration ' of 1972 on lndia for the protection of Human Environment.
  1. Explain the remedies provided under criminal law to control environmental pollution.
  1. Briefly explain the common law concepts to check environmental pollution.

Short Note

  1. Stockholm Declaration ol 1972
  1. Earth Summit 1992.
  1. Transboundary pollution.

Problem Questions

  1. Mr. John constructed a new baking oven with 12 feet chimney. His neighbour Ramesh filed an injunction petition to restrain the opening of it fearing that it would cause nuisance when bakery commenced. Will he succeed ?
    (or)
    A baking unit belonging to John had a chimney with some holes facing Shyam's properly. Shyam went to court asking for a permanent prohibitory injunction stating that in future the smoke and smell would cause him a lot of nuisance. Can he get the injunction ?
  1. A famous municipal corporation failed to provide effective drainage system in some areas of its jurisdiction, as a result of which waste water accumulated on the streets and provided place for mosquito breeding. Suggest appropriate Constitutional remedy to solve this problem.

UNIT IV - Water, Air & Noise Pollution, Wildlife Protection Act & Forest Conservation Act

Legislations

Essay Type

  1. Discuss the constitution,powers and functions of the Central Pollution Control Board under the Water Act. 6x
  1. Discuss the judicial response of conservation of forest resources . 2x
  1. Explain the salient features of Forest (Conservation) Act , 1980. 2x
  1. Define 'Air pollution '. Explain how lndian Judiciary dealt with sound pollution problem . 2x
  1. State the powers and functions ol the Central and State Boards under the Air Act, 1981 .
  1. What measures have been taken to protect our wildlife under the Wildlife Protection Act, 1972 ? How far are these measures effective ?
  1. Explain the framework of the Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1974. Discuss the identified sources of water pollution.
  1. Explain the cruelties against animal as defined in Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, 1960 . Are there any exceptions to the definition.
  1. Define noise pollution. Explain how lndian Judiciary dealt with sound problem.
  1. Explain the Constitutional remedies to check and control pollution.
  1. State the laws relating to Noise pollution control in lndia.

Short Note

  1. Protected areas. 2x
  1. Air pollution. 2x
  1. Noise Pollution. 2x
  1. Wildlife Protection Act, 1972.

Problem Questions

  1. A Fodder cutting machine was installed in a residential locality. The wind carried particles of fodder causing noise and offensive smell creating public nuisance. 'M' a resident of that locality approaches you. Advise him.
  1. A built a brick grinding machine close to a doctor's ctinic. The machine generated a lot of noise and dust which polluted the entire area and the doctor's practice suffered seriously as patients stopped visiting him. Advise the doctor. 2x
  1. Mr. 'X' had setup an eleclric fence unauthorisedly on his agricultural land to prevent the encroachment of wild animals. An elephant died as a result of electric shock on the said field. Examine the liability of Mr. X.
  1. X's house is located very near to Roman Catholic Church and because of continuous ringing of church bell 'X' wants to take an action under nuisance. Advise.
  1. During Diwali festival high sounding fire crackers were being used. Ramanand, a civilian claimed it wiil affect on health of peopre, hence seek the direction of the court not manufacture fire crackers. But fire crackers manufacturers claimed it as their right to manufacture and trade with fire crackers. Decide.
  1. Tannery and other industries were set up in the State of Karnataka. These industries discharged on enormous untreated effluents into the river. As a result of this, water of river polluted and agricultural land became totally unfit for cultivation. What kind of remedy would you suggest under criminal law ?
  1. Maheshwar Temple built by a marble stone, a prestigious temple in Pataliputra city is affected by coal based industries situated in and around the temple,
    by discharging sulfur-dioxide into the air, what kind of remedy would you suggest under the law ?
  1. ln Shivanagar hilly areas unbridled mining activity cause damage to the natural streams and polluted the streams' It caused water unfit for drinking and agricultural purpose. The people of Shivanagar are affected by this mining activity. Advise them.
  1. lmpala lndustry was working for a long time without proper consent order. The activity of the industry is causing air, water and soil pollution. Hence court imposed 150 crores as fine on the industry. Whether the award of damage stands in accordance with law ? State the principle applicable to it.
  1. Karnataka Government leased a piece of land on the bank of river Bhadra, to build a resort, which happens to be protected forest. The resort proprietor to save his leased property from water current, constructed a concrete wall along river bank, which made the river flow to swing to the other bank of the river washing away substantial part of the land where horticulturalcrops were grown. Now farmers filed a PIL questioning the validity of lease granted in favour of hotelier. What shall be the ground for petition ?
  1. X is in possession of snake skins and crocodile skins which he wants to export. He does not have a valid licence to possess and sell them. Under which provisions of law is he guilty ? Decide.

UNIT V - Environment Protection Act, 1986

Essay Type

  1. Explain the salient features of Environmental Protection Act, 1986.
  1. Explain the provisions relating to prevention, control and abatement of environmental pollution under the Environment Protection Act of 1986.
  1. What are the powers of Central Government to protect and improve environment under the Environmental Protection Act, 1986.
  1. State the punishment and penalty for the violation and non-compliance of the provisions of the Environmental Protection Act, 1986.
  1. Explain 'occupier', 'Hazardous substance, and ,Handling , as defined under Environment protection Act, 1986
  1. Explain the regulations on disposal of bio-medical waste .
  1. Explain the provisions and procedure of collection of sample .

Short Note

  1. Environment Impact Assessment. 3x
  1. Eco Mark Scheme. 2x
  1. Environmental Audit.

Problem Questions

  1. The District Authority of Kamala Nagarcity allotted the pondâ€™s land for residentiat purpose. This was questioned on the reason, it will cause ecological imbalance and affected the life of the people to live in unhealthy environment. Whether the action of the District Authority is justifiable?
  1. Shankar lndustry is cultivating shrimp culture in coastal area of Mandya causing salinity of soiland drinking water and also causing effect on the local flora and fauna.
    Suggest the remedies available under the law.

Uncategorized Questions

Essay Type

Short Note

  1. Class action
  1. Bio-diversity
  1. Offences by Government Departments.

Problem Questions

  1. Dharwad Sugar factory used to store molasses, a by-product in manufacturing sugar, in a mud tank located close to Mr. John's land. Due to burrowing activity of rodents the ' said tank containing 8000 tons of molasses collapsed and emptied themselves on Mr. John's land damaging standing crop of paddy and sugarcane. Mr. John claims compensation by filing a petition before competent court. Will he succeed ? Give reasons.
